physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial treatment with low doses of levothyroxine was required as TSH levels normalized.
Treatment began at two months of age following continued high TSH levels.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The child did not walk; choreoathetotic movements were observed, indicating psychomotor delay.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Slight psychomotor delay noted at 15 months.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Loss of balance, tremor, hyperreflexia, and mental retardation were observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked decline in verbal performance and motor skills since earlier assessments.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Poor motor skills observed, particularly in balance and gross motor scale.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Slight decline in verbal scale and manipulative skills noted from ages 5 to 11 years.
